result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Patrick Mobley in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Kyle Patrick Mobley. Court modifies bond conditions: To expand GPS for medical care and treatment.

Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring but can include medical treatment/doctor visits. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No contact with South Locust St in Janesville. No contact w/ Pawn Shops or Woodmans. Absolute Sobriety. Not to possess drug paraphernalia or controlled substance without a valid prescription. Must be in residence at all times unless at work or going directly to and from work.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Patrick Mobley in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Kyle Patrick Mobley. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for bond modification, State objects. Court denies modification of bond.
